job_details.Vacaturetitel: Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE Toolkits team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.
job_details.full_text:
Software Dev Engineer II, AWS IDEs

Come join a creative team of software developers dedicated to making it more natural and intuitive to use AWS services from their favorite IDEs. In this position you'll craft high-quality open source software, understand customers, define user experiences and shape the future of IDEs for cloud development.

   You will help us define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful. We are defining new experiences that use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer. You will interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience. You will analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs. You'll also work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services. And you'll have the opportunity to learn and grow as an engineer.

   Key job responsibilities
   - Define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful.
   - Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
   - Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
   - Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.

   On-Call Responsibility: This position involves On-call responsibility. We work as a team to root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.

   A day in the life
   Work/Life Harmony
   Our team gives high value to work-life harmony. Since the Covid19 pandemic we adjusted to remote work and established a hybrid work environment in which engineers spend 3 days working in the office, adjusted to the team needs.

   Mentorship & Career Growth
   We're committed to the growth and development of every member of the team, and that includes our development managers. As a senior software development engineer you will play a vital part in growing your peers. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the culture and direction and deliver site-wide initiatives that will improve the life of all of our teams. AWS is a growth environment - we are hiring and scaling rapidly to meet the needs of our customers. You'll have the opportunity to grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale and will have get to hire & develop other leaders along the way.

   About the team
   When we started building the IDE Toolkits team, we set out to create a place where engineers can deliver great work. That means finding and hiring people who value great engineering but who also value professional and personal relationships. We are a global business, so your ability to work with people with diverse viewpoints and backgrounds will be important. As software engineers, we need to balance a lot of things. To us, "agile" means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value to our customers - while also allowing the team to plan work and life in a predictable way, work hard without needless distractions or fire drills, and spend quality time away from work.

   We take risks, but we hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved. We have a long-term vision, but we don't do big designs up front. Our goals are clear and we are working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon.

job_profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses on software development within IDEs and mentions generative AI for productivity tools like CodeWhisperer. However, it lacks specific details on building, fine-tuning, or deploying generative models, which are core to a GenAI Engineer role. The emphasis is more on using AI to enhance developer productivity rather than developing AI systems themselves.

job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates a need to comprehend user needs and translate them into product features, aligning with understanding the business context and customer requirements.

job_tasks.phrase: define cloud-native IDE experiences that are as welcoming as they are powerful
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding the user experience and business goals for the IDE, shaping the product's direction.

job_tasks.phrase: use generative AI to help developer be more productive in their IDEs, including CodeWhisperer
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the application of AI to solve business problems (developer productivity) and mentions a specific AI-powered tool.

job_tasks.phrase: Interact with Amazon developers all over the world to identify and resolve pain points, fill in gaps in tooling, and evolve the IDE experience.
job_tasks.justification: This involves understanding user pain points and business needs to improve the product.

job_tasks.phrase: Analyze telemetry to keep us focused on our customer's needs.
job_tasks.justification: Analyzing data to understand customer behavior and needs is a key aspect of business understanding and product development.

job_tasks.phrase: Work with teams across Amazon who want to provide in-IDE experiences for their services.
job_tasks.justification: This requires understanding the needs of other internal business units and aligning technical solutions with their service offerings.
This directly refers to the creation and development of software, a core component of software engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: shape the future of IDEs for cloud development
job_tasks.justification: While not strictly MLOps, 'shaping the future' and evolving the IDE experience implies a focus on the long-term operational aspects and evolution of the product, akin to strategic operational planning.
This implies ongoing development and maintenance of the IDE experience, which aligns with the operational aspects of keeping a system functional and improving over time.

job_tasks.phrase: root-cause the issues and ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant.
job_tasks.justification: This describes core responsibilities of ensuring system reliability, fault tolerance, and issue resolution, which are key aspects of operations engineering.

technologies.justification: AWS is a major cloud computing platform.

IDEs (Integrated Development Environments) are tools used in software development, and in this context, they are the platform where AI features are integrated. While not a direct LLM framework, it's the environment for using them.
This refers to the category of AI models that create new content.
CodeWhisperer is a specific generative AI service for code completion.
This refers to software that is publicly available and can be modified, implying the use of various programming languages.

soft_skills.justification: Highlights a creative environment, suggesting innovation and a proactive approach.
Implies the need to communicate with and understand the needs of customers.
Requires understanding and translating user needs, involving communication and collaboration with users or product managers.

soft_skills.phrase: Interact with Amazon developers all over the world
soft_skills.justification: Directly states the need for interaction and collaboration with a global team.
This is a core aspect of problem-solving, requiring analysis and resolution of issues.
Indicates identifying deficiencies and finding solutions, which is problem-solving.
Suggests continuous improvement and adaptation, requiring problem-solving to enhance the experience.

soft_skills.phrase: learn and grow as an engineer
soft_skills.justification: Explicitly mentions learning and growth, indicating a need for adaptability.
On-call duties require pragmatic and timely problem-solving to address production issues.
This is a direct description of problem-solving and analytical skills.

soft_skills.phrase: ensure our systems are resilient and fault-tolerant
soft_skills.justification: Requires a pragmatic approach to system design and maintenance to achieve resilience.
While not a direct skill, it implies a team culture that values balance, often fostered through good communication and collaboration.
Mentorship involves communication, guidance, and collaboration for peer development.

soft_skills.phrase: play a vital part in growing your peers
soft_skills.justification: Directly relates to mentoring and developing others, requiring communication and collaboration.

soft_skills.phrase: contribute to the culture and direction
soft_skills.justification: Suggests taking initiative and ownership in shaping the team's culture and strategy.
Implies taking ownership and driving significant projects.

soft_skills.phrase: grow your scope of influence naturally as we scale
soft_skills.justification: Suggests a proactive approach to expanding responsibilities and influence.
Involves collaboration and communication in the hiring and development process.
Indicates a pragmatic focus on delivering high-quality technical solutions.
Highlights the importance of interpersonal skills and collaboration.
Suggests the ability to manage multiple priorities and find practical solutions.

soft_skills.phrase: agile means balancing software craftsmanship, operational excellence, and delivering value
soft_skills.justification: Demonstrates a pragmatic approach to development, balancing various aspects of software delivery.

soft_skills.phrase: plan work and life in a predictable way
soft_skills.justification: Requires pragmatic planning and organization.

soft_skills.phrase: work hard without needless distractions or fire drills
soft_skills.justification: Suggests a pragmatic approach to workflow and efficiency.

soft_skills.phrase: spend quality time away from work
soft_skills.justification: Reflects a team culture that values work-life balance, often supported by good communication and collaboration.
Indicates a willingness to innovate and try new approaches.

soft_skills.phrase: hold each other accountable for results and how the results were achieved
soft_skills.justification: Shows a sense of ownership and responsibility for outcomes.
Suggests strategic thinking and ownership of future direction.

soft_skills.phrase: don't do big designs up front
soft_skills.justification: Indicates an agile and pragmatic approach to development, avoiding overly rigid upfront planning.
Suggests a pragmatic focus on achieving defined objectives.

soft_skills.phrase: working on things that are important to everyone on the team… and to Amazon
soft_skills.justification: Implies alignment with team and company goals, requiring understanding and potentially communication of these priorities.
